tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE employee_training_records (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_id INT NOT NULL,
    training_date DATE NOT NULL,
    training_topic VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    training_duration INT NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE employees (
    employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_name TEXT,
    department TEXT,
    hire_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE training_records (
    record_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_id INT REFERENCES employees(employee_id),
    training_date DATE,
    training_topic TEXT,
    pass_status BOOLEAN
)

CREATE TABLE compliance_logs (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    record_id INT REFERENCES training_records(record_id),
    compliance_date DATE,
    compliance_status BOOLEAN
)
CREATE TABLE Employee ( employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY, employee_name VARCHAR(50), department VARCHAR(50), hire_date DATE )
CREATE TABLE TrainingSession ( session_id INT PRIMARY KEY, session_name VARCHAR(100), trainer_name VARCHAR(50), session_date DATE )

CREATE TABLE EmployeeTraining ( training_id INT PRIMARY KEY, employee_id INT, session_id INT, training_date DATE, FOREIGN KEY (employee_id) REFERENCES Employee(employee_id), FOREIGN KEY (session_id) REFERENCES TrainingSession(session_id) )

CREATE TABLE ComplianceRecord ( record_id INT PRIMARY KEY, employee_id INT, training_id INT, completion_date DATE, passed BOOLEAN, FOREIGN KEY (employee_id) REFERENCES Employee(employee_id), FOREIGN KEY (training_id) REFERENCES EmployeeTraining(training_id) )

CREATE TABLE EmployeeTrainingRecord ( 
  record_id INT PRIMARY KEY, 
  employee_id INT, 
  program_id INT, 
  training_date DATE, 
  completion_status BOOLEAN 
);
